situation.title: Accommodations
situation.meta_description: The operation of hotels and other accommodation services is limited.

content.processed:
Rules and Recommendations 

Short-term and recreational stays are generally prohibited.

Accommodation services can be provided only to persons:

  • for the purpose of a profession, or business and other similar activity. These business trips must be documented by a written confirmation from the employer or the customer. I.e. the employee must submit a confirmation from the employer that he is on a business trip, self-employed persons or entrepreneurs will have to have a confirmation from their client. This confirmation must be submitted to the accommodation service provider before the start of their stay. The accommodation provider must request confirmation and keep it for the entire stay,
  • whom was ordered to work under the Crisis Act,
  • foreigners until they are able to leave the Czech Republic and foreigners with a work permit in the territory of the Czech Republic,
  • whose been ordered isolation or quarantine,
  • in order to complete the accommodation started before the entry of this measure,
  • in order to provide a health service, e.g. if you need an expert and he / she lives far away, you can arrange accommodation for him / her (as well as his / her assistant).

If the accommodation facilities are operating because of the above exceptions, it is necessary to wear a respirator or other protective equipment without an exhalation valve with a filtration efficiency of at least 94% (class FFP2 / KN 95) in all common areas. When staying in, follow the increased hygiene rules and, if possible, stay mostly in your hotel room.

Hotel operators must regularly disinfect all areas (especially handles, corridors, railings, lifts, toilets, etc.). It is also important to take extra care to clean the rooms and handle towels and bedding. This will significantly reduce the risk of infection (for both residents and employees). There is a chance for us to return to the hotels soon, if we follow these measures. 

Exemption applies to the restaurants in accommodation establishments if they provide catering only for accommodated guests. They can stay open from 5 AM until 8:59 PM. At this time, they can also have a dispensing window and sell food and drinks to the public. These windows must follow the same rules as those operated by catering establishments intended for the public.

Pay attention to the new restriction adjusting the free movement of persons is in force from March 1, 2021. Now, you need a confirmation when you cross the district borders. Learn more about the free movement of persons here.

questions_answers.question: Do I have to wear a face mask in my hotel room?
Can I stay at the hotel when I go on a business trip?
questions_answers.value: Yes. However, you must have a written confirmation from the employer, which you provide at the accommodation facility. If you are a self-employed person, the client must issue a confirmation that it is a stay for the purpose of performing a profession.

questions_answers.question: Can I stay in a hotel if I am a foreigner, but have a work permit in the Czech Republic?
questions_answers.value: Yes, if you have met all the rules for staying in the Czech Republic. However, only on the condition that you do not have another residence in the Czech Republic. If you have a permanent or temporary residence in the Czech Republic (your own apartment, hostel, ...), then you are prohibited from staying in accommodation facilities.

questions_answers.question: CanI stay in hotel with my friends?
Can I complete my stay under the current regime if it started before the new government measures take effect?
questions_answers.value: Yes, but only if you do not have another residence in the Czech Republic.

questions_answers.question: Is it possible to be isolated in the hotel?
questions_answers.value: Yes, individual hotels have their own specific rule, we recommend to check them before your stay.

questions_answers.question: Is it possible to order food and eat in the hotel restaurant?
Can I visit my cottage or chalet?
questions_answers.value: Yes, you can visit your own cottage or chalet. However, avoid meeting with locals. Only members from one household - the same one who live together outside the recreational building - can stay in the recreational building (cottage, log cabin, etc.). It is therefore not possible, for example, for a larger family to gather in the cottage, who otherwise live in several households.

questions_answers.question: Does the COVID program - Rent apply to Airbnb?
questions_answers.value: No. It cannot be used for short-term rentals. Private apartments rented under Airbnb can be rented on the real estate market.

questions_answers.question: I find hard working from home. Can I stay in a hotel instead and work from there?
questions_answers.value: This is not possible. It is not a business trip if you don't have a client's order and for that reason you have to stay in a hotel. The purpose of all measures is to prevent mixing households so that the virus does not have the opportunity to spread. Employees who find it hard to work from home cannot use the accommodation services. This is a challenging time for everyone, try to explain your family that you need to focus and ask them for support.

questions_answers.question: Can I stay if I undergo oncological treatment, and the treatment is far way from where I live?
questions_answers.value: Yes, this applies from 15 /02/ 2021. If your medical condition requires it, your escort can also be accommodated.

questions_answers.question: Can I check in the day before  my scheduled medical consultation so I don't have to travel at night?
questions_answers.value: Yes, this applies from 15 /02/ 2021. If it is necessary your escort can also stay in the hotel/ or other type of accommodation with you. We recommend to check the measures taken by the accommodation beforehand.
